Description: Abaqus reaches the desk of engineering analysts as a robust Finite Element Analysis (FEA) software. It is designed to exploit the true generality of the theoretical potential of the method without imposing any unnecessary limitations. Abaqus assists engineers to simulate complex real-world problems for a wide range of industries and rely on it for advanced engineering simulations.
Powerful acoustic simulation software. Improve the acoustic performance of your designs with this complete simulation solution used by leading manufacturers around the world.

For an analyst performing advanced computational fluid dynamics (CFD) modeling or a design engineer quickly needing to understand fluid or thermal effects on a design proposal, Altair offers a complete set of tools to support each project. From detailed component analysis to full systems performance, Altair provides a range of scalable solvers and robust pre- and post-processing software for CFD.
Adams helps engineers to study the dynamics of moving parts, and how loads and forces are distributed throughout mechanical systems.

Features: CAE, Dynamics, HIL, Suspension, Steering, Tire, Truck
Description: With Adams Car vertical products, engineering teams can quickly build and test functional virtual prototypes of complete vehicles and vehicle subsystems. Working in the Adams vehicle vertical environment, automotive engineering teams can exercise their vehicle designs under various road conditions, performing the same tests they normally run in a test lab or on a test track, but in a fraction of time.
Adams allows you to create flexible parts conveniently even in the presence of large overall motion and complex interaction with other modeling elements.
Aimsun is a software platform used for the modeling and simulation of transportation and traffic systems.

AirSim is a powerful and versatile simulation tool aimed at advancing research and development in autonomous systems. Its realistic simulation capabilities, extensive sensor support, and open-source nature make it a valuable resource for researchers and developers in the field of autonomous vehicle technology.

Features: Cloud based simulator, CARLA, UNITY, Unreal
Description: Alpha Drive Is A Platform Providing Cloud-Based Data And Tools For Testing And Validation Of AI Algorithms.
Altair® Twin Activate™ is an open and flexible integration solution that enables whole system simulation with real-time digital twin deployment through any stage of the product lifecycle.

Flux captures the complexity of electromechanical equipment to optimize their performance, efficiency, dimensions, cost or weight with precision, bringing better innovation and value products to end users. Flux simulates magneto static, steady-state and transient conditions, along with electrical and thermal properties.

Altair® Inspire™ is an intuitive, powerful family of integrated software products that accelerates simulation-driven design throughout the product development lifecycle, from concept to reality, while reducing product time-to-market.

ANSA is an advanced multidisciplinary CAE pre-processing tool that provides all the necessary functionality for full-model build up, from CAD data to ready-to-run solver input file, in a single integrated environment.

Features: CAE, Mechanical, CFD, Thermal, Acoustics, Autonomous Vehicles, Digital Twin, Electromagnetics, Embedded software, Fluids, Optics, Structures, Semiconductors
Description: ANSYS is a suite of engineering simulation software developed by ANSYS, Inc. It's widely used across various industries for simulating and analyzing how products will behave and perform in real-world scenarios before they are actually manufactured or deployed. ANSYS software covers a wide range of disciplines including structural analysis, fluid dynamics, electromagnetics, and more. It's often used by engineers and designers to optimize designs, troubleshoot problems, and reduce the need for physical prototypes, ultimately saving time and resources in the product development process.
CFD software for turbomachinery applications.

Ansys Fluent is a general-purpose computational fluid dynamics (CFD) software used to model fluid flow, heat and mass transfer, chemical reactions, and more. Fluent offers a modern, user-friendly interface that streamlines the CFD process from pre- to post-processing within a single window workflow.

Features: CAE, Drop tests, Impact and Penetration, Smashes and Crashes, Occupant safety
Description: Simulate the Response of Materials to Short Periods of Severe Loading. Ansys LS-DYNA is capable of simulating the response of materials to short periods of severe loading. Its many elements, contact formulations, material models and other controls can be used to simulate complex models with control over all the details of the problem.

Ansys Mechanical is a finite element analysis (FEA) software used to perform structural analysis using advanced solver options, including linear dynamics, nonlinearities, thermal analysis, materials, composites, hydrodynamic, explicit, and more.

Ansys Motion is a completely integrated simulation environment for both component and system modeling. It provides fast and accurate analysis for both rigid and flexible bodies, simultaneously, all from a single solver. System motion performance, stress-safety analysis, heat transfer, vibration and fatigue are integral.
Motor-CAD enables design engineers to evaluate motor topologies and concepts across the full operating range, to produce designs that are optimized for performance, efficiency and size.

Tool: Ansys Rocky | Particle Dynamics Simulation Software
Description: Ansys Rocky a discrete element method (DEM) software used for simulating the motion of granular and discontinuous material. Rocky is designed to solve engineering problems. Rocky is uniquely capable to models real particle shapes including any solids, 2D shells, and rigid and flexible fibers. The simulations are fast and accurate. With multi-graphics processing unit (GPU) solver technology, you can simulate the behavior of different shaped and sized particles in many industrial applications.

Tool: Ansys Sherlock | Electronics Reliability Prediction Software
Description: With embedded libraries containing over one million parts, Sherlock rapidly converts electronic computer-aided design (ECAD) files into computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and finite element analysis (FEA) models.

Ansys Thermal Desktop includes all aspects of thermal model creation, including built-in finite difference, finite element, and lumped capacitance objects that can be combined into any configuration to solve complex thermal and fluid flow problems.
Apollo is a high performance, flexible architecture which accelerates the development, testing, and deployment of Autonomous Vehicles.
AppGameKit is a game creation system for mobile cross platform development.
ArduPilot is a trusted, versatile, and open source autopilot system supporting many vehicle types: multi-copters, traditional helicopters, fixed wing aircraft, boats, submarines, rovers and more.

AutoForm’s software solutions form a comprehensive platform for the engineering, evaluation and improvement of the sheet metal forming and BiW assembly processes. This platform allows for full digitalization, seamless information and data flow, and integration of Industry 4.0 standards.

Features: ADAS, AD, Maps, OpenDRIVE, SIL, HIL, Simulink
Description: Automated Driving Toolbox provides algorithms and tools for designing, simulating, and testing ADAS and autonomous driving systems. You can design and test vision and lidar perception systems, as well as sensor fusion, path planning, and vehicle controllers.

Autoware is an open-source software stack for self-driving vehicles, built on the Robot Operating System (ROS). It includes all of the necessary functions to drive an autonomous vehicles from localization and object detection to route planning and control, and was created with the aim of enabling as many individuals and organizations as possible to contribute to open innovations in autonomous driving technology.

Features: CAE, SIL, ADAS, Battery, Fuel Cell, Hybrid
Description: AVL CAMEO™ with its new integrated Functional Testing for Automotive Software, opens up a new dimension of superlatives for the DevOps engineer in automotive development. With new interfaces to SiL, HiL and in-vehicle it expands its activities to the necessary test environments. Description: With AVL EXCITE™, you get an innovative multi-body dynamics software solution for powertrain analysis. The tool calculates the dynamics, vibration and acoustics of combustion engines, transmissions and complete ICE-based or electrified drive units.
Combines the proven tools AVL FAME™ M Engine and AVL FAME™ Poly. It is integrated in the AVL Simulation Desktop and is called AVL FAME™ M Engine S.

Features: Hybrid EVs, Plug-in hybrid EVs, Battery EVs, Fuel cell EVs
Description: A versatile test system (TS) for validating pure ice and electrified propulsion systems.

Enables accurate test scenario design for Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) and Automated Driving (AD) for effective test planning and maximum test coverage. Effortlessly create various scenario definitions and visualize them with the integrated scenario player.

Shape your vehicle’s character and develop its distinctive driving DNA. Break free from subjective testing limitations, evaluate countless maneuvers and objectify driving attributes in a reproducible and user-friendly way. In real-time, throughout all development phases, in the virtual and real world.

Features: MIL, ADAS, Sensors, Soft-Body Physics, Driving Simulator

With our custom build physics engine and detailed vehicle models, we are taking data acquisition to the next level by combining a high degree of physical realism with elaborate sensor models and photo-realistic imagery.

Description: CARLA has been developed from the ground up to support development, training, and validation of autonomous driving systems. The simulation platform supports flexible specification of sensor suites, environmental conditions, full control of all static and dynamic actors, maps generation and much more.

Open integration and test platform for virtual test driving.

Features: Dynamics, Scenario Based Testing, MIL, SIL,HIL, VIL, Real-Time, Traffic, ADAS, AD, Powertrain, Data analysis and evaluation

Features: CAE, CAD, CFD, FEA, Fluids, Electrical, Structural, Vibration, Thermal

Description: CommonRoad is a collection of composable benchmarks for motion planning on roads, which provides researchers with a means of evaluating and comparing their motion planners.
Construct is a game development tool designed to make game creation accessible and straightforward, especially for individuals who may not have extensive programming experience.
CONVERGE features autonomous meshing, state-of-the-art physical models, a robust chemistry solver, and the ability to easily accommodate complex moving geometries.

Description: CosiMate uses an open architecture based on a co-simulation bus. This solution offers two major advantages, an open architecture enabling multi-point integration and communication of heterogeneous simulators, and the ability to simulate models across the network optimizing CPU usage and simulation performance.
Thermo-fluid analysis software is a simulation tool used for analyzing complex thermal/fluid phenomena. Software simulation enables predicting performance prior to hardware prototype.
Physical simulations that take into account real world physical properties in a realistic manner to provide easily configurable and dynamic scenes.

Features: Kinematic & dynamic applications in robotics and computer animation
Description: DART (Dynamic Animation and Robotics Toolkit) is a collaborative, cross-platform, open-source library. It provides data structures and algorithms for kinematic and dynamic applications in robotics and computer animation.

Defold is a cross-platform game engine known for its lightweight design and powerful features, enabling developers to create high-quality 2D games. While Defold doesn't come with pre-built vehicle simulations, its flexibility and scripting capabilities allow developers to implement a wide range of vehicle types and simulations.
NI DIAdem is software for managing, analyzing, and reporting data collected during data acquisition and/or generated during simulations.

Features: AD, ADAS, Sensors, HIL, GPU, CUDA
Description: NVIDIA DRIVE Sim™ is an end-to-end simulation platform, architected from the ground up to run large-scale, physically based multi-sensor simulation. It's open, scalable, modular, and supports AV development and validation from concept to deployment, improving developer productivity and accelerating time to market.

Features: HIL, Dynamics, Combustion Engine, Electric, Simulink
Description: ASM is a tool suite for simulating combustion engines, vehicle dynamics, electric components, and the traffic environment. The open Simulink models are used for model-based function development and in ECU tests on a hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulator.

Dymola, Dynamic Modeling Laboratory, is a complete tool for modeling and simulation of integrated and complex systems for use within automotive, aerospace, robotics, process and other applications. Rapidly solve complex multi-disciplinary systems modeling and analysis problems.

Features: Virtual Test Driving, Vector, Real-Time, Dynamics, Engines, HIL, Electric, Sensors, Traffic
Description: An open simulation environment for the virtual test driving of cars and commercial vehicles. The physical models include vehicle dynamics, powertrain, combustion engines, electric motors, sensors and traffic.

Features: CAE, Control systems, Hydraulics, Pneumatics, Gaseous flow, Thermal, Electrical, Mechanical, Refrigeration, Environment control, Lubrication, Fuel systems
Description: Accurately simulate control systems, hydraulics (including thermal effects), pneumatics, gaseous flow, thermal, electrical, mechanical, refrigeration, environment control, lubrication or fuel systems, and sampled-data/discrete-time behaviour.
Engine Simulation is the process of using computer software to simulate a dynamometer (dyno) so you can see what changes to the engines assembly generate greater or lesser horse power or torque.

Features: OSI, OpenDrive, OpenScenario, Unity, Traffic, Dynamics
Description: ESMini is a lightweight, open-source simulation tool focusing on the development and testing of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) and autonomous driving features. It provides a platform for simulating traffic scenarios, vehicle dynamics, and interactions with the environment

The Future Automotive Systems Technology Simulator (FASTSimTM) provides a simple way to compare powertrains and estimate the impact of technology improvements on light-, medium-, and heavy-duty vehicle efficiency, performance, cost, and battery life.
Software for fatigue life prediction and lightweight design.

Flow is a traffic control benchmarking framework. It provides a suite of traffic control scenarios (benchmarks), tools for designing custom traffic scenarios, and integration with deep reinforcement learning and traffic microsimulation libraries.

FLOW-3D is a computational fluid dynamics (CFD) software used for simulating fluid flows in various engineering applications. Developed by Flow Science, Inc., it is known for its powerful and accurate modeling capabilities, particularly in handling complex free-surface flows and multiphase flows.

The Functional Mock-up Interface is a free standard that defines a container and an interface to exchange dynamic simulation models using a combination of XML files, binaries and C code, distributed as a ZIP file. It is supported by 200+ tools and maintained as a Modelica Association Project.

GameMaker is a complete development tool for making 2D games, used by indie developers, professional studios, and educators worldwide. Create games for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android, iOS, HTML5, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch.

Features: Robotics, ROS, 3D visualizer, Sensors, Physics, Transportation
Description: Gazebo is an open-source 2D/3D robotics simulator that began development in 2002. In 2017, development forked into two versions, known as "Gazebo", the original monolithic architecture, and "Ignition", which had moved to becoming a modernized collection of loosely coupled libraries.
Develop your 2D & 3D games, cross-platform projects, or even XR ideas

GT-POWER is used to predict engine performance quantities such as power, torque, airflow, volumetric efficiency, fuel consumption, turbocharger performance and matching, and pumping losses, to name just a few.

Features: CAE, Integrated Multi-physics Systems Simulation, Fluids, Electric, Thermal, Acoustics, Mechanical, Controls
Description: Offers engineers functionalities ranging from fast concept design to detailed system or sub-system/component analyses, design optimization, and root cause investigation.
HaxeFlixel is a 2D Game Engine that lets you create cross-platform games easier with free, open source technology
HEEDS facilitates efficient exploration and optimization of design options and parameters within the design space, enabling engineers to achieve superior results with greater ease and effectiveness.
Applied Intuition HIL Sim empowers ADAS and AD engineers to test and validate their hardware platforms and features. It shortens development and verification workflows

Altair® HyperMesh® is a powerful simulation solution that redefines CAE design processes across industries with unmatched pre- and post-processing capabilities for finite element modeling. Powered by AI-augmented 3D modeling and visualization tools, next-gen design and optimization workflows
HyperStudy is a multidisciplinary design study software that enables engineers to explore and optimize their product performance and robustness.

Features: CAE, Structures, Motion, Fluids, Thermal, Electromagnetics
Description: The Altair HyperWorks platform empowers engineers, scientists, designers, and more to tackle physics simulation and concept design challenges across multiple disciplines for structures, motion, fluids, thermal, electromagnetics, electronics, controls, and embedded systems

CFD++ is a computational fluid dynamics (CFD) software developed by Metacomp Technologies. It is a versatile and powerful tool used for simulating fluid flow, heat transfer, and related physical phenomena.

Isight and the SIMULIA Execution Engine (formerly Fiper) integrate multiple cross-disciplinary models and applications within a simulation process flow. They automate the execution across distributed compute resources, explore the resulting design space, and identify the optimal design parameters within defined constraints.
Used for electromagnetic field analysis and simulation, particularly in the design and analysis of electric machines, transformers, actuators, and other electromagnetic devices.
KISSsoft® is a modular calculation program for the design, optimization and verification of machine elements according to international standards.

​​​​​​​​​​​Thermal management simulation is essential in the development process of every new vehicle. Understanding how individual components influence the overall system is necessary for an optimal design regarding energy consumption, emissions, noise, fatigue, and other parameters.
libGDX is a cross-platform Java game development framework based on OpenGL (ES) that works on Windows, Linux, macOS, Android, your browser and iOS.
MAGMASOFT leads to robust and cost effective solutions in component design, tooling lay-out and production.

Our powerful tool enables quick and seamless conversion between various formats, catering to your unique modeling and simulation needs. With just a few clicks, our software can convert data from HERE HD Live Maps® to ASAM OpenDRIVE® and produce files that are ready for use in simulations or procedural environment generation.

O3DE (Open 3D Engine) is an open-source, real-time, multi-platform 3D engine that enables developers and content creators to build AAA games, cinema-quality 3D worlds, and high-fidelity simulations without any fees or commercial obligations.

NVIDIA PhysX® is an open source, scalable, multi-platform physics simulation solution supporting a wide range of devices, from smartphones to high-end multicore CPUs and GPUs.
The powerful SDK brings high-performance and precision accuracy to industrial simulation use cases from traditional VFX and game development workflows, to high-fidelity robotics, medical simulation, and scientific visualization applications.

Transient Lattice Boltzmann-based physics PowerFLOW CFD solution performs simulations that accurately predict real world conditions. Using the PowerFLOW suite, engineers evaluate product performance early in the design process

Simcenter durability simulation software gives you access to state-of-the art fatigue analysis methods that enable you to perform analyses quickly and accurately.

Tool: SUMMIT (Simulation of Urban MObility with Integrated Traffic)

Description: SuspensionSim is used by model users and model builders. Model users are engineers and designers who work with a given suspension layout, change hardpoint coordinates and stiffness properties, and then evaluate the suspension behavior by analyzing simulated test results.
This simulator was built for Udacity's Self-Driving Car Nanodegree, to teach students how to train cars how to navigate road courses using deep learning

Description: VTD is a toolkit for the creation, configuration, presentation and evaluation of virtual environments in the scope of road and rail based simulations. It is used for the development of ADAS and automated driving systems as well as the core for training simulators. It covers the full range from the generation of 3d content to the simulation of complex traffic scenarios and, finally, to the simulation of either simplified or physically driven sensors.
traffic simulation software PTV Vissim digitally reproduces the traffic patterns of all road users on a microscopic scale.
